revised_title: Blast Wave Properties: Particle Trajectory Analysis
tldr: The authors analyzed the particle trajectories within blast waves from two large trinitrotoluene (TNT) explosions using high-speed photography of smoke tracers. They determined the density, pressure, temperature, and sound speed within the blast waves by applying the Lagrangian conservation of mass equation and assuming adiabatic flow. This technique allowed them to describe all the properties of a blast wave based on experimental measurements alone, providing accurate results comparable to other forms of measurement.
